bill_title: revise the composition of the Board of Pardons and Paroles.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the composition of the Board of Pardons and Paroles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 24-13-1 be amended to read as follows: 24-13-1. The Board of Pardons and Paroles shall consist of nine ten members. Three Four members shall be appointed by the Governor; at least one shall be an attorney and at least one shall be an enrolled member of a federally recognized Indian tribe . Three members shall be appointed by the attorney general; at least one shall be an attorney. Three members shall be appointed by the Supreme Court; at least one shall be an attorney. Each member of the board shall be a resident of South Dakota and be appointed with the advice and consent of the Senate. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the composition of the Board of Pardons and Paroles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 24-13-1 be amended to read as follows: 24-13-1. The Board of Pardons and Paroles shall consist of nine ten members. Three Four members shall be appointed by the Governor; at least one shall be an attorney and at least one shall be a South Dakota resident who is an enrolled member of the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe, the Crow Creek Sioux Tribe, the Flandreau-Santee Sioux Tribe, the Lower Brule Sioux Tribe, the Oglala Sioux Tribe, the Rosebud Sioux Tribe, the Sisseton-Wahpeton Oyate Sioux Tribe, the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe, or the Yankton Sioux Tribe . Three members shall be appointed by the attorney general; at least one shall be an attorney. Three members shall be appointed by the Supreme Court; at least one shall be an attorney. Each member of the board shall be a resident of South Dakota and be appointed with the advice and consent of the Senate. Section 2. That § 24-13-2 be amended to read as follows: 24-13-2. The members of the board shall serve for terms of four years. Members are eligible for reappointment. The Governor, the attorney general, and the Supreme Court each shall appoint three members, whose terms shall expire on the third Monday in January of the fourth year after appointment. Each member shall serve until a successor takes office as provided by law. In case of a vacancy, the appointing power shall make an interim appointment to expire at the end of the next legislative session.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the composition of the Board of Pardons and Paroles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 24-13-1 be amended to read as follows: 24-13-1. The Board of Pardons and Paroles shall consist of nine eleven members. Three Four members shall be appointed by the Governor; at least one shall be an attorney. Three Four members shall be appointed by the attorney general; at least one shall be an attorney. Three members shall be appointed by the Supreme Court; at least one shall be an attorney. Each member of the board shall be a resident of South Dakota and be appointed with the advice and consent of the Senate. Section 2. That § 24-13-2 be amended to read as follows: 24-13-2. The members of the board shall serve for terms of four years. Members are eligible for reappointment. The Governor, the attorney general, and the Supreme Court each shall appoint three members, whose terms shall expire on the third Monday in January of the fourth year after appointment. Each member shall serve until a successor takes office as provided by law. In case of a vacancy, the appointing power shall make an interim appointment to expire at the end of the next legislative session.
